```{r}
# Define Halving Dates including the projected 2024 halving
halving_dates <- as.Date(c("2014-07-09", "2016-07-09", "2020-05-11", "2024-04-20"))
names(halving_dates) <- c("2014 Halving", "2016 Halving", "2020 Halving", "2024 Halving")

# Function to define periods around each halving date
define_periods <- function(halving_date) {
  pre_bull_start <- halving_date - 270            # Starts 9 months before halving
  pre_bull_end <- halving_date - 1                # Ends the day before halving
  halving_day <- halving_date                     # The day of halving
  bull_run_start <- halving_date + 1              # Starts the day after halving
  bull_run_end <- halving_date + 540              # Lasts 18 months
  crypto_winter_start <- bull_run_end + 1         # Starts immediately after Bull Run
  crypto_winter_end <- bull_run_end + 720         # Lasts 24 months

  data.frame(
    Period = c("Pre-Bull", "Halving Day", "Bull Run", "Crypto Winter"),
    Start_Date = c(pre_bull_start, halving_day, bull_run_start, crypto_winter_start),
    End_Date = c(pre_bull_end, halving_day, bull_run_end, crypto_winter_end)
  )
}

# Apply the function to each halving date and combine the results into a single data frame
period_dfs <- lapply(halving_dates, define_periods)
all_periods_df <- do.call(rbind, period_dfs)

# Split the combined data frame into separate ones for each period
period_dfs_list <- split(all_periods_df, all_periods_df$Period)
PreBull <- period_dfs_list$`Pre-Bull`
HalvingDay <- period_dfs_list$`Halving Day`
BullRun <- period_dfs_list$`Bull Run`
CryptoWinter <- period_dfs_list$`Crypto Winter`

# Verify the data frames by printing
print(PreBull)
print(HalvingDay)
print(BullRun)
print(CryptoWinter)

```
